data.title: Atom 0.180+ Detected as Malware via Comodo
data.body:
On install of the .deb package (from 0.180.0 on), Comodo determines that the following file is malware under the **Heur.Deual.Extensions@@4294967295** name.

```
/tmp/temp-lintian-lab-EZeXThRA8O/pool/a/atom/atom_0.182.0_amd64_binary/unpacked/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/6to5-core/node_modules/core-js/src/core.log.js
```

data.title: Atom Versioning Scheme will fall over in ~70 releases on Windows
data.body: On Windows, every block of the version number (i.e. X.Y.A.B) is limited to the range [0-255]. Currently this number is a monotonically increasing number on the minor version on Windows, which will eventually fail once we hit 0.256.0. Plenty of time to fix this, but that's precisely why I wanted to bring it up _now_ and not _later_ :)

data.title: FSPathMakeRef(/Applications/Atom.app) failed with error -43.
data.body:
I suddenly started getting this error -- after using atom without issue for over a year.

I just completely uninstalled and reinstalled atom following these steps 
Delete the app from the Applications folder
rm -rf ~/.atom
rm /usr/local/bin/atom
rm /usr/local/bin/apm
rm ~/Library/Preferences/com.github.atom.plist
rm ~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt
rm -rf ~/Library/Application Support/Atom/

Then I got the installer from atom.io, copied in into my Applications directory,  reinstalled the shell commands, and still got the follow error when running "atom" in the terminal.

I finally solved this issue by moving the Atom program from my 

~/Users/calekennedy/Applications

to 

~/Applications

I wanted to add this issue in case someone else encounters it in the future.

data.title: Tree View "Hide Ignored Names" not working.
data.body:
![nothidden](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1903876/6301517/6ed4b86e-b8ec-11e4-86fe-19111dd53b81.png)

```
$ apm list | grep tree
├── tree-view@0.157.0
```

```
$ atom --version
0.180.0
```

```
$ cat ~/.gitignore_global | grep pyc
*.pyc
```

And from within the repository which is being displayed in the screen shot:

```
$ cat .gitignore | grep pyc
*.pyc
```

data.title: Can't create a new file
data.body:
It seems I can't create a new file on the current Atom window, neither using `FIle > New file` nor `Ctrl+N`

I updated form 0.180.0 to 0.181.0 this morning. No other update nor package install.
After the update, I noticed  a problem with y tree-view (#5617), and re-opened my usual folder.

The only way I found to create a new file is to _open a folder_ (wich creates a new Atom window according to #5615) **then** I can _create a new file_.

**Atom Version**: 0.181.0
**System**: Microsoft Windows 8.1
**User installed packages** (in case it may be a collision ?)

``` coffee
autocomplete-plus, v2.1.6
color-picker, v1.4.4
column-select, v0.1.0
emmet, v2.3.3
file-icons, v1.4.11
flatland-dark-ui, v0.2.3
linter, v0.11.1
linter-csslint, v0.0.11
linter-jshint, v0.1.0
linter-php, v0.0.11
open-last-project, v0.3.1
tomorrow-night-eighties, v0.4.0
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/874898/6281718/5b0865f0-b91a-11e4-89ab-4eaa51a6a455.png)

Would be great if it opened atom.io/packages so that we can see what the package offers e.g. https://atom.io/packages/git-blame for the given example

data.title: Search input box should trim carriage return
data.body:
I'm new for Atom so I don't have a clue how to fix this.

On Windows, I copy some text that have a trailing carriage return from other application, such as excel, notepad, then try to search the opening doc in Atom. Then I was surprising that there's no match. Because you cannot see the trailing carriage return in any form on the editor, you may not aware the fact that you are actually searching a 2-lines text.

The search input box seems to be a single-line one, so I guess we may need to trim CRs and LFs there.

Atom Version `0.181.0 2015/2/19 上午5:56:33`

data.title: Report deprecations from tasks
data.body:
Setup Grim in the task process and report back deprecations to the app.

![screen shot 2015-02-19 at 11 17 02 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/6274017/f269b7ca-b828-11e4-9e8a-c90825c505a0.png)

Closes #5525

data.title: Copy paste of text aligned with spaces (e.g. asterisk-aligned PHPDoc) sometimes loses the alignment with soft tabs off
data.body:
Easiest to reproduce with PHP grammar, and the "doc_f" snippet. Soft tabs needs to be off (it's fine with it on.)

Create a new PHP file and use doc_f snippet. You'll get a PHPDoc block which uses the recommended formatting - the asterisks are aligned vertically using an additional leading space.

When copy and pasting... this space is lost if you paste on an already indented line. ANIGIF below shows the reproduction, and shows that on an empty line it pastes OK, but on pasting with indentation the spaces aligning the asterisks are lost.

![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/939815/6273202/41e81dbe-b865-11e4-8ea5-a5354bdbb50c.gif)

In case someone thinks aligning the asterisks is bad practice - it's actually customary for PHPDoc. See first glossary entry on the PHPDoc website:
http://www.phpdoc.org/docs/latest/glossary.html

**Edit: Removed the root cause bit - I've put it in the PR**

Thanks!

data.title: Add Project::removePath
data.body: The tree-view needs to be able to remove a path from the project.

data.title: Uncaught Error: EEXIST, file already exists
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Try to save a modified file.

Out of the blue trying to save a file triggered this error, after opening, editing, saving files from the same place for a while. The file is on a samba share. This seems similar to #5518, but in my case there's no sign of the disk having become unavailable. I can open and save other files from the same folder on the same share. But even after that I still can't save the original file.

**Atom Version**: 0.179.0
**System**: Microsoft Windows 7 Home Premium 
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: EEXIST, file already exists '\server.\share\dir\dir\src\rsrc\model'

data.title: Module Version Mismatch Error At Startup
data.body:
On my computer, Atom is failing at startup and throwing errors as shown below. As a result I am unable to use it for last couple of weeks.

OS: Ubuntu 14.10
Atom: 0.181.0
Node: 0.11.15
NPM: 2.5.1

```
index.js:65 Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 17, got 41.
    at Error (native)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (/opt/atom/resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:422:20)
    at Module.load (module.js:363:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
    at require (module.js:392:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:6:13)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:207:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
    at Object.loadFile [as .js] (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/6to5.js:138:21)index.js:65 window.onload

/opt/atom/resources/app/src/space-pen-extensions.js:64 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'dispatch' of null
```

data.title: Combining One UI Theme with Solarized Syntax Theme results in coloring Atom UI
data.body:
Selecting any of the **One** UI Themes together with **Solarized** syntax highlighting results in weird colored Atom UI:

![screen shot 2015-02-19 at 15 49 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/422139/6268718/2e331b68-b84f-11e4-841d-d9573a7b487b.png)

Other combinations looks normal: 
![screen shot 2015-02-19 at 15 56 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/422139/6268854/eca2ffaa-b84f-11e4-8d60-8adf1334fe62.png)

Atom version: 0.181.0@Mac OS X

data.title: Programmable snippets
data.body:
Just wondering if there is any way to make programmable snippets like in yasnippets for emacs.

Kinda like:

``` javascript
var BrowserWindow = require('browser-window');
```

In this example, when typing `BrowserWindow` the text inside the require statement is converted from camel case `browser-window`

This would be awesome.

Anyway I could help?

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT, open 'C:\xampp\htdocs\lessCoffee\main.less'
when opening multiple windows the folder name is ignored and open the atom folder - .after  0.181
data.body: when opening multiple windows the folder name is ignored and it opens the atom folder. I think this is only after the forced update. So If I open 1 window with the folder and another with another folder the second window automatically goes to atom's folder. Is there option in window to downgrade.

data.title: Cursor doesn't fully cover hard tabs, but only the first space of a tab
data.body:
Taken from: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/2119

Current: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2461189/6e0b44ca-af74-11e3-8f77-5a3db21c7dcc.png)

Desired: ![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/189989/2461183/56305ce6-af74-11e3-985a-ddc437efae2a.png)

I'm tagging this as a feature request -- I think that even vim covers only the first space?

cc @execjosh

data.title: New window command creates new file when window has no project path
data.body:
In 0.181.0 on OS X. Steps to reproduce:
1. `atom --safe`
2. `cmd-shift-n`
3. `cmd-shift-n` in the new window. A new file is created instead.

If you then open an existing file in the new window, giving it a project path, the new window command starts working again.

data.title: Dragging files into a new window is not possible
data.body:
I was trying to replicate the following issue (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5590) when I stumbled upon this one.

Dragging a file from window to another was not possible unless a previous file was already open. I had to open another (even if Untitled) file to be able to drag the tab onto the other window. The dragging symbol appeared, instead of the crossed circle for invalid, but after releasing the mouse button nothing changed.

I don't know if this might be caused by the Theme I currently (and forever, it's beautiful) use. If it is I'll refer it to the proper channels.

Win 7 64bit
Atom -v181
Seti-UI (theme)

data.title: Minor release naming request for linux
data.body:
Could we get the version number in the _deb_ file that is posted on the github downloads page. It's pretty straight forward for me to grab the next version every time its released but when I need to quickly rollback my folder has a bunch of `atom-amd64(N).deb` files.

Super minor and I'll no longer care once we get an offical PPA going but for the time being it'd be awesome.

data.title: Support building with node 0.12.x and io.js 1.x
data.body:
Make Atom buildable with node 0.12.x and io.js 1.x

Closes #3184
Closes #5493
Closes #5591

data.title: join-lines should do the right thing when lines have a prefix (e.g. # or // comments)
Extreme Performance issues after 0.180.0
data.body:
First I'd like to say the new text parsing improvements are GREAT. :dancer:

But I can only guess that they've caused a memory leak or something. After opening a few large files in a couple different windows and letting an hour or so pass by, my computer was barely responding.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5841107/6258331/9af9be7e-b77c-11e4-9034-b13d1b3a4c93.png)

That red spike is memory usage was Atom. Each process was taking about 200 megs or so. I think it's normally around 15mb?

If it happens again, please let me know what other details I can give.
